qas.question: Which two fields of study are associated with immunology?
Immunology studies how which three areas impact one another?

answers.text: the body systems, pathogens, and immunity

qas.question: When was the first written mention of immunity as it pertains to the body?
Which Greek historian made that notation?
When did immunology start to become codified as a scientific theory?

context: Classical immunology ties in with the fields of <a0_0>epidemiology and medicine<a0_0/>. It studies the relationship between <a1_0>the body systems, pathogens, and immunity<a1_0/>. The earliest written mention of immunity can be traced back to the plague of Athens in <a2_0>430 BCE<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Thucydides<a3_0/> noted that people who had recovered from a previous bout of the disease could nurse the sick without contracting the illness a second time. Many other ancient societies have references to this phenomenon, but it was not until the <a4_0>19th and 20th centuries<a4_0/> before the concept developed into scientific theory.
